title: CTRL0000087795 - Transcribed Interview of Mark Robinson, (July 7, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Zoom, commencing at 10:12 a.m.
Representatives Aguilar, Schiff, Lofgren, and Murphy.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
, SENIOR COUNSELOR TO THE VICE CHAIR
We can go on the record at 10:12 a.m.
This is a transcribed interview of retired Sergeant Mark Robinson
conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the
United States Capitol, pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd ask the witness to please state your full name and spell your last
My name is Mark Evans Robinson, and the last name is
This will be a staff-led interview, and members that
are present, of course, can choose to ask questions as well.
At this time, I'd ask for other members of the committee to announce themselves
I'm an investigative counsel for the committee.
senior counsel to the vice chair.
Nice to meet you and thanks very much for being here.
In terms of members, we also have Mr. Adam Schiff and
Ms. Stephanie Murphy that are present.
, sorry, I didn't see you on.
If you want to announce yourself for
At this time, could counsel for the Metropolitan Police
Department please state their name for the record?
So, before we begin, Mr. Robinson, we'll go through a few ground rules with you,
and I know you're aware of these from your career with MPD but just want to make sure
This is an official interview, so it's being transcribed.
that's recording this interview, and she's joining us by Webex.
When I ask each question, can you please just wait until we finish the question
That way it's clear for the record.
nonverbal responses, I'll indicate that for the record, but we'll also ask that you please
make every answer verbal for us so that it's clear what your answer is.
We ask that you provide complete answers just based on your best recollection.
If you don't remember something, it's okay to say that you don't remember it, but to the
best of your recollection, we'll ask that you please answer each question.
Please let us know if you need any breaks or would like to discuss anything with
Ms. Quon after any of our questions, and we'll go on a break.
That way you can meet with her.
Also, I have to remind you that you have to tell the truth.
investigation, so you have to tell the truth to the best of your ability.
And, also, again, if you have any questions, need any breaks, just let us know.
Do you have any questions for us before we get started?
So, Mr. Robinson, please just give us a little bit about your background, your
educational background, how you became -- started working at the Metropolitan Police
Well, I'm a high school graduate and also a United States Military vet.
joined the Metropolitan Police Department in 1990, and I retired May 21, 2022.
I spent 32 years with the Metropolitan Police Department and 3 years with the Fairfax
What branch of the service were you in?
Were you an MP in the Army?
What various roles did you have within the Metropolitan Police
I started out at the Fifth District.
the -- probably about 12 years or so with the SOD, Special Operations Division.
I went to the Training Academy.
At the Training Academy, I was an instructor there until
And, in 2004, I got promoted to a sergeant, went to the First District Substation,
Then I was recruited to come back to SOD to work with the Automated Traffic
back to SOD, where I stayed there until I retired.
I was there until it was civilianized.
And, just for the record, Mr. Aguilar has joined.
So SOD, so that's Special Operations Division.
Presidential Motorcade Unit falls within MPD?
So how long were you assigned to the Presidential motorcade in
I think you might have said it, but just to make sure.
I was initially in SOD traffic in 1992 to 1999.
And what were your responsibilities within SOD?
So, from 2011 to May 21, 2022, was my duration
And we provided the assignments for the
members assigned, handling demonstrations, handling the POTUS -- the POTUS escorts,
All foreign dignitaries that responded to the area, we provided escorts for them as
well, the motorcades, and dealt with any civil uprisings within the city, large-scale
So, with the POTUS movement, just walk us through how that would
us through that process with the POTUS movements in particular.
So, a lot of times, Secret Service would contact the Metropolitan Police
Department and Special Operations Division via email.
So we would receive information either through a
And it would come as a daily assignment.
We also have a Planning Division that would get the assignments as well.
roll call sergeants would get the assignments and assign members to the motorcade itself.
And so, the way it worked, we would have a lead vehicle, a tail vehicle, and
Metropolitan Police would provide three motors.
their three motors, and Secret Service provided three motors as well.
And so, if you had a medium, they would get motors as well -- medium dignitary in
the area, meaning their security level.
the same treatment as a POTUS.
And then you have U.S. Park provide
And, if you had a high, of course, they would get
So you said earlier, I think you mentioned roll call earlier, and so that's the
individual that assigns the MPD officers for the POTUS movements that day?
And that's the role you were in I'm assuming in 2021, 2022?
So, on January 6 -- I'm jumping ahead, but we'll get there later.
It would be the roll call sergeant.
have assigned the MPD officers for the POTUS movements on January 6th of 2021?
So, because that was a major movement, the -- it came from the
So the assignments came from the Commander of
also be Lieutenant Margiotta, who would have got the details.
That would be Robert Glover, who's now retired.
And so oftentimes I would be assigned to the POTUS because of my seniority and
And so Lieutenant Margiotta would like -- always wanted an
official to be on the POTUS motorcade as the lead vehicle.
I'd also like to note for the record that Ms. Zoe Lofgren has joined.
So I know within the SOD who was assigned the POTUS movements.
any other units within MPD that would assist with the POTUS movements other than
They would call in other additional units from patrol, you know, to handle
traffic posts if we were -- didn't have sufficient manpower for it.
And you said that the actual request would come in via email.
Who would that request come in to?
Can you spell that last name for us, please.
And when you were coordinating these movements for POTUS, did you all
communicate on the standard MPD radio or was there a special frequency or radio that
We would often use special events channel, and sometimes we
would have three frequencies, MPD 1, MPD 2, MPD 3.
And what would be communicated on this radio typically for a POTUS
We would announce whether or not the POTUS is moving, if he's moving to
arrived and POTUS is at the location.
We will announce traffic closures, and we will announce whether or not we have
If he's about to return, we will announce that as well, preparing.
to make traffic closures at that time, we would make traffic closures.
would -- we will announce the return.
Were you all at MPD responsible for the route, or would that come from
No, it was a collaborative joint, you know, information.
route would be established between Lieutenant Margiotta and Secret Service.
would have meetings, and they would come up with -- they would develop the route
some unforeseen problems, with the TS agent or the lead agent with Secret Service.
And who was the point of contact, if you know, from Secret Service that
would be doing this collaboration with you all?
If it's a problem, then the lead vehicle would also discuss that route, if there's
It would either be the -- whoever's assigned -- and it's rotating -- whoever's
assigned as the TS agent, transportation agent, or the lead agent for Secret Service.
Typically, how much notice were you given for POTUS movements?
Were there ever times where you had to make a movement, I'm sure there
were, but less than 24 hours' notice?
Can you just describe some of those times?
I assumed it, but can you just
I mean, sometimes, I mean, we received notices as late as a half an hour, you
And that's when they would communicate to Lieutenant Margiotta that we
And oftentimes, we would have to respond expeditiously
Does anyone have any followup to those questions?
Mr. Robinson, let me ask you this:
was a major movement that day.
Do you recall the reason why it was considered a
major movement that day instead of just a regular movement to the Ellipse?
Because I know there was a speech involved, and I know that that meeting
itself, I don't know if they were preparing for anything.
expected what was going to happen on January 6th to happen, to occur.
But I know we had a lot of protesters within the area itself, and I think it was high,
a high movement, and we did have personnel, CDU units and all of that in the area.
Do you know if there was any discussion of any routes or anything in regards
to back and forth to the Ellipse that day on any of the frequencies, any trouble or
anything mentioned on the frequencies during that day moving back and forth to the
I believe we was on special events channel, and I was monitoring the
individuals along Constitution Avenue that were armed, that were up in the trees, and I
can hear the units responding to those individuals.
when there's a POTUS in the area.
And so I could hear some of the units pointing out to individuals that there were
And so there's always a concern
Mr. Robinson, I just wanted to, before we get into the details of January 6th
itself, just zoom out a little bit.
In the days preceding, were you also working any of the movements with the
Were there any conversations you had or rumors indicating that the
President may want to go to the Capitol on January 6th in the days before?
But on January 6th, while at the Ellipse, the TS
agent did advise that the President wanted to go to the Capitol from the Ellipse.
I think while he was speaking and then shortly after he had finished speaking, that
was being discussed and which the TS agent relayed to myself that the President wanted
Before we get into that in a little bit more detail, who was that TS agent?
And where was he receiving that information from?
You know, they have their own radio channels,
And so I guess he's hearing the transmissions and
Mark said he wanted to go to the Ellipse.
ask that question and answer it again so that it accurately reflects that the President
wanted to go to the Capitol, unless that's not what you meant?
Mr. Robinson, can you just -- I think you started with what a TS agent
detail with January 6th itself, but to Ms. Murphy's question.
Can you just go through that again.
And then we're going to start with more
While on the scene at the Ellipse and the TS agent was receiving
communication from his -- through his channels, and he had mentioned to me that the
President wanted to respond to the Capitol from the Ellipse.
And I believe you said that was during the speech, correct, Mr. Robinson?
So let's just start from the beginning, though.
your day out at the White House picking up the President and then to the Ellipse?
Again, did you hear any conversations about what was the atmosphere in
terms of just making that movement from the White House to the Ellipse?
Well, not from the White House to the Ellipse, because pretty much it's still
on the White House Grounds so it's pretty much a secure Complex.
However, there was a lot of demonstrators in the area, and that was cause for
individuals in the area that were armed.
And, like I said, again, for MPD, I could hear the radio transmissions with
And, on that radio channel, so the special events channel, is that only MPD,
or is there the Service and Park Police on there?
I believe Park Police and Service do have the capability of monitoring those
Monitoring, but do you hear any of the Secret Service monitoring that comes
it overlaps with other law enforcement.
I'm just wondering if your sources over the radio is solely MPD or if
Predominantly, it is MPD, but we do share those frequencies.
are times when you would hear Capitol -- I've only heard Capitol and Park Police over the
channel, come over the air itself.
But on that particular day, predominantly it was MPD.
Did you hear any of the Secret Service radio frequencies during any
I could hear only the movements because they have multiple channels.
there is a channel that -- there's a radio that Secret Service provide in the lead car and in
can hear when he's preparing to leave, depart.
And so we can hear when the President's moving to the vehicles, and we
And so that's when we're able to call
But I can't -- they have multiple channels that they communicate on,
So, when you're hearing the movements in the lead vehicle that you're in,
who is relaying that information from the Secret Service?
Probably one of their supervisors and then -- yeah, it's one of the supervisors
But -- and if you don't know, that's fine.
the person who's actually in the President's vehicle or in another one of the vehicles of
the motorcade that's relaying the information.
Oftentimes, it's the TS agent and I believe the lead agent communicating on
So -- and the lead agent, are you familiar with who the lead agent was for
Do you work with the same Secret Service folks when you are involved with
But does the lead detail for the President himself, Robert Engel, are
So you get to the Ellipse.
Can you just talk us through what
So the motorcade parks, and we're on standby until the President is finished
The President did exit his vehicle and went into a secure tent prior to the speech.
I know he did the speech and then returned back to the tent and returned back to the
What was the plan, as it was conveyed to you all, about what was going to
happen at the Ellipse and the movement after?
So, while on the Ellipse, we know that there were discussions about the
President leaving the Ellipse and responding to the Capitol.
concerned that he wanted to make that movement because I was hearing, like I said, the
traffic on the radio with the large-scale demonstration.
as to what was happening at the Capitol, but there was concern on Secret Service part
And I didn't have a clear picture
And what did you hear specifically?
I could hear -- I could hear I believe at that time Commander Glover sending
CDU troops to the Capitol, responding.
And they were saying that there were
demonstrators there attempting to breach the Capitol.
What time were you hearing that information?
I believe that, if I'm correct, probably about 1:30, 2 o'clock.
So let's just establish some timeframes here.
speech began at noon and ended around 1:09, 1:10.
So, knowing that that was the start of the speech, what time do you think
you got to the Ellipse as part of the motorcade?
So I believe we arrived maybe a little -- a little after 11, maybe 11:50, 40 or
I don't recall the time exactly.
I believe it was a Dodge SUV.
And you were the lead car, and was the President's car the one behind you?
You have -- it's the lead car, and it's the vehicle called corner back, which is
And what type of vehicle are you in that day?
Then you have the President's limo, and then you have a spare
So there's four cars in total?
Well, it's more than that, but those are the cars that I recall that's behind the
So, when you get to the Ellipse and you park, do you stay in your
vehicle, or do you go into the tent at all?
No, I stay in my vehicle.
And, in the vehicle, you have the MPD communications as well as the special
That is the MPD communication, but you also
have a radio that's provided by Secret Service.
So, just to go back to when you said the -- when the TS agent told
you that the President wanted to go to the Capitol, that was while the President was
That was during the speech and after the speech.
What -- let's just take it from the first part, during the speech.
discussed when the TS agent conveyed that to your folks at the MPD?
He just mentioned that the President -- there's a possibility that the
President is going to go to the Capitol.
And was there any action taken that you know of?
No, because it wasn't confirmed at that time.
And so my responsibility is just to inform my units, which was mainly the tail car and my
And do you know if the TS agent was reacting to what the President said in
his speech, or were there independent conversations that triggered him to tell you that?
I believe it was communications over his radio.
Which would be the Secret Service radio?
Which is the radio that you don't have -- you didn't have that
over the radio versus what you hear directly.
Just trying to establish what you hear
agent is announcing that the President is moving.
the President is moving so we can prepare for departure or arrival.
No, like I said, they have multiple channels that they
And so the radio in the car I can just hear when probably the lead
You also have supervisors that are
So they are communicating to the lead and TS agent that
And so in the other communications that I'm not privy to that they're talking
about the movement from the Ellipse to the Capitol.
So when -- do you know if a route was established at any point
while the President was speaking to provide him a path to get to the Capitol?
Fortunately, there was no route discussed, because it had not been
confirmed that we were going to actually make the movement.
So there wasn't -- do you know if there was any discussion of any route at all
in terms of just like as a preliminary plan, even though it hadn't been established that he
No, because, like I said, while we were still at the Ellipse, we didn't know
what was happening outside of the Complex.
And so, in order to even attempt to
develop a route, I would have had to communicate with probably Lieutenant Margiotta to
come up with a route from the Ellipse to the Capitol.
based on what was happening outside of the Complex.
And that would have had to be
So, at the end of the speech, we do know that while inside the limo, the
So, at the end of the speech, what was the plan supposed to be?
President was still adamant about going to the Capitol.
That's being relayed to me by
And so we did depart the Ellipse and we responded back to the White House.
However, we -- the motorcade, the POTUS motorcade was placed on standby.
we were told to stand by on West Exec until they confirm whether or not the President
was going to go to the Capitol.
And so I believe we may have waited I would just estimate maybe 45 to -- 45
minutes to an hour waiting for Secret Service to make that decision.
Did you say the President entered the
So how -- just walk us through in as much detail as you can.
the President leaves the tent and enters his vehicle, how do you learn that he was
adamant about still wanting to go to the Capitol?
That is -- the information is being relayed to me by the TS agent who's in the
And was there any description of what was occurring in the car?
And so our communication was he's telling me that the President wants to
He's upset, and he wants to go.
Only that -- the only description I received was that the President was
upset and that he was adamant about going to the Capitol, and there was a heated
When you say "heated," is that your word, or is that the word that was
The word described by the TS agent meaning that the President was
upset, and he was saying there was a heated argument or discussion about going to the
And so that's [inaudible] to stand by.
I'm sorry, it faded out a little bit.
That was why we were told to stand by the Presidential
So when are you told this exactly?
It's prior to departure, leaving the Ellipse, en route to the Capitol -- I'm sorry,
en route to the White House.
Is it before you leave the Ellipse?
It's a short trip from the Ellipse.
And so, when we arrived at West Exec, the TS agent just told us to stand by
because they had not made a decision whether or not we were going to transport the
But let me just back up.
Before you get to West Exec, you're still
before your vehicle starts moving or while you are still waiting at the Ellipse after the
When was the information relayed to you about the heated argument,
Well, it was prior to -- we're waiting.
So the information is being relayed to
me that the President is having this discussion about going to the Capitol.
while we are departing, the information is being relayed to me that we -- the President
still wanted to go to the Capitol.
And so, once we arrive at West Exec, we're then told to
Before you get to West Exec, one second.
Ellipse area, do you remember, once the President got into his vehicle, did you all
immediately start moving towards the White House, or was there some delay?
Myself, I'm a few vehicles ahead.
So, once we know he was loaded, then I
check with the TS agent and see whether or not we're ready to depart.
And so we do what we called a slow roll.
I guess the followup is, when you're doing that slow roll, approximately how
long was it before the slow roll before you started actually moving?
Did you receive the information about, in your words, the
heated discussion while you were doing that slow roll or before you even started the slow
Before we started the slow roll and while we're actually moving.
Mr. Robinson, how long do you think it took you to depart from that Ellipse
there where the drop-off and pickup point to the South Grounds there?
From the Ellipse to West Exec, probably -- probably -- I mean, it's not that
[Inaudible.] no longer, no longer for that movement.
So that would encompass, that slow roll, you'd probably say 2 to 3 minutes?
And all of that conversation that we're talking about happened
During that timeframe and also while we're waiting at West Exec.
Now, let me ask you this:
Is that normal that you would sometimes wait
30, 45 minutes before -- you know, if something was taking place, is that normal that you
guys would wait there, or is that something that is not normally done?
No, that's -- I wouldn't say that's nor -- that's not normal.
secondary movement, then we are advised of that.
And there are times when we may
wait maybe 10 or 15 minutes, maybe 20 at the max for Secret Service to make a decision
whether or not there's going to be another movement so we can prepare for that.
Once you got to West Exec, Mr. Robinson, who were you communicating
with in terms of telling you to stand by for that period of time until a decision was made?
I was communicating with the TS agent that's inside my car.
Going back -- I think you mentioned it, but I just want to make sure it's clear
What kind of vehicle was President Trump in on January 6th?
He was in the Presidential limo.
So you don't recall which one out of those two?
I don't know if it was a truck or the
Mr. Robinson, you mentioned the limo.
Is the truck vehicle, is that
Are you familiar with that term?
So that truck vehicle that you mentioned would be the Suburban, and then
there's a limo that they call the Beast?
The heated discussion or argument that you mentioned, sir, do you recall anything
And so that's why we were placed on standby.
And were you able to hear a discussion of why either the Secret
Service or others were urging him not to go to the Capitol?
No, other than the President was upset and that the President
was adamant about going to the Capitol.
Just a couple of quick questions.
else that was said about the nature of that argument?
on another channel, Secret Service, that I'm not privy to.
But the information I'm relying on is being communicated directly by the TS agent.
And so he gave me the impression that he was alarmed, and I can sense that there was
How often have you been part of the President's motorcade?
I -- when I came back to SOD in 2011, I essentially took over after
I Sergeant Earps (ph) had retired, Sergeant Steve Earps (ph).
Presidential motorcade since 2011 up until I retired 2022.
So about how many times would you say you've been part of that
And, in that hundred times, have you ever witnessed another
discussion of an argument or a heated discussion with the President where the President
was contradicting where he was supposed to go or what the Secret Service believed was
What happened once you got to the West Exec and then you were there you
movement for the rest of the day?
Is it the same TS agent tells you then that there's going to be no
So, while waiting at West Exec, the agent did come back out and
advise us that the President is not going -- not going to the Capitol.
POTUS team remained in the area and we remained in the area until we heard
Commander Glover give the 1033 signal to respond to the Capitol.
So, once we heard Commander Glover give the 1033 response over the
And then what did you do at that point?
radio, my team, I informed my team to respond to the Capitol.
House area from downtown, probably Pennsylvania Avenue, and responded to the
So you were at the White House until about 3 o'clock until you received the
call from Commander Glover, and then you reported to the Capitol Building?
We had left the White House Grounds, but we were still in close, close
I believe we was at 20th and Pennsylvania Avenue and staged because
Lieutenant Margiotta wanted us to be staged in the area because our primary
responsibility for that day was POTUS.
At any time on the 6th, even before you got to the Ellipse, did you hear
about any specifics regarding the crowd, in terms of size, in terms of items they were
carrying, what was being seized at magnetometers?
knowledge in terms of over the radio or through just talking to others?
Did any of that come into your
Well, while at the Ellipse, I can see that there was a large crowd on the
I can also see prior to responding to the White House that there was a large
crowd already on -- a large presence already on Constitution Avenue.
And so I can hear on the MPD radio that there were individuals -- and this is
probably during the movement and during the Ellipse while the President was speaking,
that individuals was in the area and did have weapons.
did make contact with individuals in the crowd that did actually have weapons.
And I believe there was -- MPD
And we were receiving information from -- complaints that there were cars in the
area, and I remember specifically L'Enfant Plaza, vehicles -- weapons were seen in a
vehicle, so units did respond to that.
So I can just hear those type of responses on the
Then, just to get back to the President's movement, in the time that
you were waiting or in any time afterwards, did you learn about what was going on within
Were there any updates as far as why you all were sitting there and
So the only update I received was the fact -- was whether or not they were
going to confirm that we weren't actually going to motorcade to the Capitol.
was what I was waiting for.
So it's fair to say, when the President was dropped off at the White House
until you then ultimately left, it was still an open question whether he was going or not
until it was confirmed by that TSA agent?
And was that the same TSA agent that you were in touch with that was
communicating to you from the time the President was giving his speech and
In any -- while you were sitting there, again, before you left the Ellipse, when
it was conveyed that the President adamantly wanted to go, was there -- and I think Mr.
Schiff asked this but just to drill down -- was there a response given as to why he could
There was no response given to me, per se, other than -- and so I'm just
waiting for the Secret Service to confirm whether or not we're actually going to respond
to the Capitol or if the move is going to be canceled.
Did you learn later that day or in the days following why the President was
not allowed to or permitted to go to the Capitol?
Did you have your own sense, in your own law enforcement experience,
whether that would have been a good idea for the President to go to the Capitol that
Because, even after receiving a 1033, it was difficult for myself, my team, the
In my sense, it would have been a horrible -- a horrible decision to respond
POTUS team, which is my vehicle, the tail car and the three vehicles, to respond to the
All of the routes that we would normally use were at a heavy capacity with
And, when I arrived at 3rd and Constitution, it was being blocked by a large
They wasn't -- they were not allowing vehicles to come in
how I was able to make it to the Capitol.
I had to take an alternate route, which was
And I came in through the Capitol's secured barricade, and that's
But, just to be clear, though, that's still around like 3 o'clock after the 1033
But prior to, around the 1:10 time period, when the President wanted to go
to the Capitol, would that have been possible?
different an hour and a half later.
Obviously, the time period is a little bit
One, we would have -- we didn't have -- we didn't have plans to do it.
we didn't have resources in place.
compound, the White House, it's a secured route, which means that we would have
personnel along the route for traffic closures.
And so none of that was in place.
Because oftentimes when the President leaves the
And so that, again, would not have been good
for the motorcade to move because we didn't have resources in place for that movement.
Were you involved with off-the-record movements with the President
And those could occur, as I think you said earlier, in a time of like 30 minutes'
Thirty minutes' notice is still mostly -- Lieutenant Margiotta, the way he ran
the unit, even when we have those 30-minute timeframe to respond and do a movement,
he would still provide as many units as he can to cover critical traffic points.
So, just so -- in the off-the-record movements that you were involved in
before, it's possible to have such a thing happen in less -- with less notice.
Were you part of the November or December off-the-record
movements when there was a MAGA rally November 12th and December -- I'm sorry,
November 14th and December 12th, when the President's motorcade drove by?
I was -- I do remember being assigned to the motorcade, and I do
remember Commander Glover telling us not to be involved with that OTR movement.
Because this was something that was unusual.
first came out I think the barricade at 15th and E Street, which is not normal.
Presidential motorcade drove through that MAGA crowd.
Glover did not want MPD assets to get involved.
So, just so I'm clear, so that November rally when the President drove by in
the motorcade, MPD was not involved in that?
Was it because he was driving into a crowd that you normally try to avoid, is
that why you all didn't want to be involved?
So let's [inaudible] this a little bit more.
For a time that -- for the
coordination that goes on with Secret Service and MPD for a movement of the President,
there can be a movement that MPD is not aware of.
Mr. Robinson, just a couple more questions.
To take you back to waiting,
to the Ellipse when you're in the car and you get -- the TS agent conveyed the President
adamantly wanting to go to the Capitol.
Was that in person or did that come over the
No, that was in person to me that he's communicating that the President
wants to go to the Capitol.
And that TS agent is in your vehicle?
And that he's getting that radio communication over his Secret Service radio.
And was it over the radio, or was there like cell phones being used, do you
They do wear an earpiece, and so I guess he can hear certain
transmissions that I can't hear because they communicate I believe over two radio zones.
And that -- that TS agent, can you describe what he looks like?
I don't recall from that day.
